channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Totally prepared': Trump allies say he's better positioned than ever to enact agenda

item.description: President Trump said Wednesday that he will soon release classified documents related to the assassinations of President Kennedy and civil rights lead...

item.title: Truckers File Lawsuit Arguing They Shouldn’t Lose Second Amendment Rights Just Because They Cross State Lines
item.description: A complaint challenges Minnesota’s refusal to recognize lawfully issued firearms permits of 29 other states.

item.title: Trump says it's 'sad' Biden didn't pardon himself
item.description: President Trump said he could have pardoned himself when he was leaving the White House for the first time, but ultimately decided not to.

item.title: Are famous short sellers going extinct? The exit of Hindenburg Research and Andrew Left shows the risky trade is shrinking
item.description: Indicted short seller Andrew Left tells Fortune a “chilling effect” is making “everyone think twice.”

item.title: Trump suggests shuttering FEMA, letting states handle own disasters
item.description: President Trump suggested that the Federal Emergency Management Agency could be shut down to instead let the states handle their own disasters.

item.title: Has Trump Learned That Russia Is the Problem?
item.description: The world looks different from behind the Resolute Desk.

item.title: Marco Rubio heading to Panama on first trip as secretary of state: ‘We won’t continue to ignore the region’
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is expected to head to Panama soon for his first international trip as the nation’s top diplomat, Fox News has learned.

item.title: House approves Laken Riley Act immigrant detention bill that would be Trump’s first law to sign
item.description: A crucial faction of 46 politically vulnerable Democrats joined with Republicans to lift the strict proposal to passage on a 263-156 vote tally.

item.title: Perfection in Houston, Courtesy of the Menil Collection
item.description: Or, near perfection, since I’d ditch its DEI hogwash.

item.title: Trump’s Magnificent Blow Against DEI
item.description: To its great credit, the Trump administration is pointing to a more just and fair future.

item.title: How Nike’s new CEO plans to rebound from its worst year ever
item.description: A Fortune profile of Elliott Hill chronicles his career journey at the retailer and a turnaround strategy.

item.title: Climate Change Doesn’t Care What You Think About It

item.description: The Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board (PCLOB) may lose its ability to function by the end of Thursday, undermining a key U.S.-EU agreement.

item.title: How Trump’s Second Administration Can Take Down The Porn Industry
item.description: To make America great again, we must be bold and brave enough to go on offense against obscenity.

item.title: The Forgotten Victims of Government Overreach
item.description: When the state comes after ordinary citizens, too many must endure long waits and arduous legal proceedings to secure justice — if they get it at all.

item.title: Celebrities Can Afford Divorce Lawyers, But The Emotional And Social Costs Hit Everyone
item.description: Even when couples can easily afford lawyers, divorce's emotional and psychological costs are incalculable.

item.title: Passive Funds: The Secret Ingredient to Smarter Active Portfolio Management
item.description: This post explores how passive investments complement active strategies, driving better results for clients and portfolios alike.

item.title: How California’s Mismanagement of Fire and Water Makes Wildfires Worse
item.description: There are systemic failures going back many years, which have combined to undermine California’s ability to prepare for and respond to fires.

item.description: Epic incompetence from Democrats can only be excused by blaming the California fires on a sinful mankind that is changing the climate.

item.title: If The U.S. Government Doesn’t Ban TikTok, Parents Should
item.description: Threats to national security aside, apps like TikTok are bad for people and should therefore be banned or highly regulated.

item.description: Yan-David Erlich, previously CRO and COO at AI unicorn Weights & Biases, is joining B Capital, he exclusively tells Fortune.
